app.tooltip.vip.address: Virtual IP is a private IP used to communicate with Members

app.tooltip.execute.action:
Actions are executed when the L7 Policy meets conditions. The actions are as follows:
- REJECT: The request is denied with an appropriate response code and not forwarded to any backend pool.
- REDIRECT_TO_URL: The request is sent a HTTP redirect.
The URL is defined in the url parameter.

app.tooltip.l7.policy.status: Status of the L7 Policy: On/Off
app.tooltip.l7.rule: An L7 Rule is a simple logic test that returns either true or false. It must always be associated with an L7 Policy
app.tooltip.reverse.mechanism: Invert the comparison result of the L7 Rule
app.tooltip.key: Key used for comparison. For example, the name of the cookie to evaluate
app.tooltip.value: Value used for comparison. For example, the file type to compare
app.tooltip.sticky.session: It's the method of streamlining messages sent to members. Messages marked under the same session will be collectively sent to the server. It's related to session tagging method
app.tooltip.internet.facing: Using a public IP address allows the load balancer to route requests from clients over the internet
app.tooltip.subnet: It is the IP address range used for allocating IP addresses when employing load balancing
app.tooltip.internal:
Using private IP addresses. Thus, the load balancer can only route
requests from clients with access rights to the VPC to the load balancer
app.tooltip.ip.address:
The IP address of the customer. In case the customer does not provide an IP address,
the system will automatically assign one. If the customer does provide an IP address,
the system will use that IP for the load balancer if it's not already in use by anyone else
app.tooltip.service.package:

Active Connection: The maximum total active connections within 1 second
Data transfer: Data transferred in the form of bits and bytes over a digital or analog medium
And this process allows for the transmission of both digital or analog communication and its movement between devices

app.security.title: Two-factor authentication feature
app.security.alert.title: For added security, we recommend configuring 2-Factor Authentication to help protect your account.
app.security.alert.des: Two-factor authentication (2FA) is a powerful security measure used to protect online accounts. Instead of just using one means of authentication like a password, 2FA requires users to provide another authentication factor (OTP via email) to prove they are the owner of the account. This greatly increases the safety and security of your account, because someone else needs to have both to gain unauthorized access.
app.security.input.title: OTP code will be sent to Email
app.security.switch.title: Turn on two-factor authentication
app.security.note: Or read more about our privacy policy
app.security.noti.sucess: Sign in with two-factor authentication enabled

kafka.edit.confirm-content: You are performing a version update for Apache Kafka. Please click Confirm to proceed with the version update
kafka.edit.confirm-note: To avoid issues during processing, upgrades must be performed sequentially and downgrading versions is not permitted.
kafka.upgrade.title: Upgrade Kafka service
kafka.upgrade.note: The client can only upgrade the configuration to a higher level than the current one being used.
kafka.upgrade.value.invalid: The value must be higher than the currently used level
kafka.upgrade.ram-min: The minimum RAM value is 1 GB
kafka.upgrade.ram-max: The maximum RAM value is 64 GB
kafka.upgrade.cpu-min: The minimum CPU value is 1 vCPU
kafka.upgrade.cpu-max: The maximum CPU value is 16 vCPU
kafka.upgrade.storage-min: The minimum Storage value is 1 GB
kafka.upgrade.storage-max: The maximum Storage value is 2000 GB
kafka.extend.title: Extend Kafka service
tooltip.kakfa.topic.max-message-bytes: The maximum size of one message
tooltip.kakfa.topic.min-insync-replicas: The number of in-sync replicas (including the leader) currently being synchronized
tooltip.kakfa.topic.unclean-leader: Enables or disables the ability to elect a leader when the leader broker loses connection with some replicas
tooltip.kakfa.topic.compression-type: Data compression method when pushing into the topic
tooltip.kakfa.topic.leader-replication: The list of replicas of the leader partition that the user wants to limit the replication speed from the leader to. Control or manage the replication speed for specific replicas
tooltip.kakfa.topic.message-downconversi: Parameter indicating whether the system allows automatic down-conversion of data when it is sent from the Producer with a higher protocol version down to a lower protocol version to meet the requirements from the Consumer
tooltip.kakfa.topic.delete-retention: The minimum time a message will be retained in a partition (in milliseconds) before being deleted
tooltip.kakfa.topic.segment-jitter: The parameter defining a random time interval added to the time of creating a new segment in the log. This random time interval helps prevent all partitions in the broker cluster from creating new segments at the same time, distributing the load and reducing the load on the broker
tooltip.kakfa.topic.flush: The minimum time interval between data pushes from the producer to the broker
tooltip.kakfa.topic.follower-replication: Specifies the list of replicas that the Kafka Broker limits the replication speed from the leader to
tooltip.kakfa.topic.segment-bytes: The maximum size for a segment of the log on the broker (in bytes)
tooltip.kakfa.topic.flush-messages: This setting allows specifying a time interval at which data will be forced to fsync to the log
tooltip.kakfa.topic.retention-ms: The minimum time a message will be retained in a partition (in milliseconds), a value of -1 indicates an unlimited time
tooltip.kakfa.topic.message-format: The Kafka protocol version used for the producer and consumer. Misconfiguring this parameter can lead to the Consumer using an old version that cannot use the data
tooltip.kakfa.topic.max-compaction-lag: The maximum time a message will not qualify to participate in the log compaction process. Only applies to logs that are being compacted. After compaction, the system retains only the latest value of messages with the same key
tooltip.kakfa.topic.file-delete: The delay time before deleting a file from the filesystem
tooltip.kakfa.topic.message-timestamp: Specifies how Kafka handles message timestamps
tooltip.kakfa.topic.min-compaction: The maximum time a message will not qualify to participate in the log compaction process. Only applies to logs that are being compacted. After compaction, the system retains only the latest value of messages with the same key
tooltip.kakfa.topic.preallocate: Determines whether the system should preallocate space for the segment before writing data
tooltip.kakfa.topic.min-cleanable: Determines the minimum ratio of dirty (uncompacted) data to clean (compacted) data that Kafka retains before performing compaction
tooltip.kakfa.topic.index-interval: The size of an entry in the index file of a segment (in bytes)
tooltip.kakfa.topic.retention-bytes: The maximum number of bytes a partition can retain before old data is deleted, a value of -1 indicates unlimited capacity
tooltip.kakfa.topic.segment-ms: The maximum time a segment of the log can exist before creating a new segment, a value of -1 indicates unlimited time
tooltip.kakfa.topic.message-timestamp-di: The maximum time limit between the timestamps of producer messages and the timestamps of messages when written into the system
tooltip.kakfa.topic.segment-index: The maximum size for an index file of a segment (in bytes)
validation.service.name-required: The service name cannot be empty
validation.service.name-length: The service name should be between 5 and 50 characters
validation.service.name-pattern: The service name can only include lowercase letters, uppercase letters, numbers, and the characters _ and -
validation.kafka.broker-required: The number of brokers cannot be empty
validation.kafka.duration-required: The duration of usage cannot be empty
validation.kafka.topic.name-required: The Topic name cannot be empty
validation.kafka.topic.name-pattern: The Topic name can only include letters, numbers, and special characters -
validation.kafka.topic.name-length: The Topic name must be between 5 and 255 characters long
validation.kafka.topic.replica-length: Replication factor value is between 1 and 3
validation.kafka.topic.replica-invalid: The Replication Factor value must not be smaller than min.insync.replicas
validation.kafka.topic.minInsync-length: The min.insync.replicas is an integer value ranging from 1 to 3.
validation.kafka.topic.minInsync-invalid: The min.insync.replicas value must not be greater than the Replication Factor
validation.kafka.topic.segmentByte-inval: The segment.bytes value must be greater than max.message.bytes
validation.kafka.topic.segmentByte-lengt: The segment.bytes is a positive integer ranging from 14 to 2,147,483,647 bytes
validation.kafka.topic.maxMessage-invali: The max.message.bytes value must be smaller than segment.bytes
validation.kafka.topic.maxMessage-length: The maximum message size is in the range of 1 to 100,000,000 bytes
tooltip.kafka.numPartitions: Configure the maximum number of partitions a topic can have when it is created. Each partition is a part of the topic and contains a portion of the data. Partitions help Kafka distribute and process data efficiently
validation.kafka.numPartitions-length: The value of num.partitions is a positive integer in the range of 1 to 100
tooltip.kafka.replicationFactor: Configure the default number of replicas for a topic when it is created
validation.kafka.replicationFactor-lengt: The value of default.replication.factor is a positive integer in the range of 1 to 3
validation.kafka.replicationFactor-inval: The value of default.replication.factor needs to be greater than or equal to min.insync.replicas
tooltip.kafka.minInsyncReplicas: Specify the minimum number of replicas of a partition that the producer needs to wait for acknowledgment from before considering the message as safely written
validation.kafka.minInsyncReplicas-lengt: The value of min.insync.replicas is a positive integer in the range of 1 to 3
validation.kafka.minInsyncReplicas-inval: The value of min.insync.replicas needs to be less than or equal to default.replication.factor
tooltip.kafka.offsetTopicReplica: Configure the default number of replicas for the '__consumer_offsets' topic; this topic stores information about the offset of consumers, helping to track the reading position of each consumer in each partition
validation.kafka.offsetTopicReplica-leng: The value of offset.topic.replication.factor is a positive integer in the range of 1 to 3
tooltip.kafka.logRetentionHours: Configure the retention time for logs of partitions in Kafka; this setting determines how long log data will be retained before being deleted. The value -1 indicates no limit
validation.kafka.logRetentionHours-lengt: The value of log.retention.hours is an integer in the range from -1 to 2,147,483,647
tooltip.kafka.logSegmentBytes: Configure the maximum size of each segment in the log of a partition; logs in Kafka are divided into segments for efficient data management and deletion
validation.kafka.logSegmentBytes-length: The value of log.segment.bytes is a positive integer in the range from 1 to 10,737,418,240 (10GB)
router.alert.connect: A router connects devices in a network by forwarding data packets between them using assigned local IP addresses for each device on the network.
router.alert.connect2: This ensures that data packets reach their intended destination without getting lost within the network.

app.vlan.note10: Subnet name cannot contain special characters
app.vlan.note11: Subnet name already exists, please enter a different name
app.vlan.note13: Subnet must be a subnet range of network x.x.0.0/16 (selected network CRID)
app.vlan.note16: DHCP is a dynamic IP address allocation mechanism for that subnet. That means when creating a Port without specifying any IP, DHCP will automatically assign an IP to the created Port. Advantages: No need to manage IP addresses, the system will automatically assign IP addresses. Disadvantages: DHCP will use 03 IPs for the DHCP server. This leads to the situation where if the subnet has only 8 IPs, for example, only 5 IPs will be available.
app.vlan.note17: Please select ranges within: '172.16.0.0 - 172.24.0.0', and '192.168.0.0', and enter the correct address format: x.x.0.0/16, x.x.x.0/24
app.vlan.note18: If a subnet is added to Router interface, the Gateway IP cannot be disabled, and vice versa, if a subnet does not have a gateway, it cannot be added to Routerinterface
app.vlan.note19:
If not entered, the system will automatically take the first IP address in the network range as the gateway, for example: 10.21.0.1
- If left blank, the system will automatically take the first IP address in the network range as the gateway
app.vlan.note21:
Enter a starting IP and an ending IP of the network range separated by a comma
Choose ranges within: '10.21.0.0 - 10.255.0.0', '172.16.0.0 - 172.24.0.0', and '192.168.0.0', and enter the correct address format: x.x.0.0/16, x.x.x.0/24
The second IP must be greater than the first IP (for example: 172.16.0.2, 172.16.0.3)
app.vlan.note22: Invalid IP address format, IP separated by commas (,).
app.vlan.note23: Invalid IP address. Please select ranges within: '172.16.0.0 - 172.24.0.0', and '192.168.0.0', and enter the correct address format: x.x.0.0/16, x.x.x.0/24.
app.vlan.note24: Invalid IP address, the second IP is greater than the first IP (for example: 172.16.0.2, 172.16.0.3)
app.vlan.note28: Subnet must be a subnet range of network x.x.0.0/16 (selected network CIDR)
app.vlan.note30: Please select ranges within: '172.16.0.0 - 172.24.0.0', and '192.168.0.0', and enter the correct address format: x.x.0.0/16, x.x.x.0/24
app.vlan.note31: If a subnet is added to Router
app.vlan.note32: DHCP is the mechanism for dynamically assigning IP addresses to the subnet. This means that when creating a Port without specifying an IP, DHCP will automatically assign an IP to the newly created Port. Advantages: No need to manage IP addresses manually, as the system will automatically allocate them. Disadvantages: DHCP will use three IPs for the DHCP server, which reduces the available IPs in the subnet. For example, if the subnet has only 8 IPs, only 5 will be available.
app.vlan.note34: If not entered, the system will automatically take the first IP address in the network range as the gateway. For example: 10.21.0.1. If left blank, the system will automatically take the first IP address in the network range as the gateway.
app.vlan.note36: Enter a starting IP and an ending IP of the network range separated by a comma. Required to choose ranges within: '10.21.0.0 - 10.255.0.0', '172.16.0.0 - 172.24.0.0', and '192.168.0.0'. Enter the IP addresses in the correct format: x.x.0.0/16, x.x.x.0/24. The second IP should be greater than the first IP. For example: 172.16.0.2, 172.16.0.3.
app.vlan.note37: Invalid IP address format, IPs should be separated by commas (,).
app.vlan.note38: Invalid IP address. Required to choose ranges within: '172.16.0.0 - 172.24.0.0', and '192.168.0.0'. Enter the IP addresses in the correct format: x.x.0.0/16, x.x.x.0/24.
app.vlan.note39: Invalid IP address. The second IP should be greater than the first IP. For example: 172.16.0.2, 172.16.0.3.

project.note6: Customers can create either a regular project or a VPC project - providing a comprehensive package of compute, storage, and network infrastructure that allows customers to set up virtualized data centers on VNPT Cloud.
project.note7: or learn more about project management
project.note10: To delete a project, please enter the project name for confirmation.
project.note11: You are performing project deletion {{name}}. This action cannot be undone
project.note13: You are performing VPC project deletion {{name}}</br>Deleting a VPC project will also delete the data inside the VPC project, which may directly affect the services within the VPC project</br>This action cannot be undone.
project.note15: To delete a VPC project, please enter the VPC project name for confirmation.
project.note16: Not including special characters, spaces, Vietnamese, maximum 50 characters
project.note34: For regular projects, users can proactively add bonus services. For VPC projects, when purchasing VPC, users can purchase quota for accompanying bonus services.
project.note37: Initialize VPC Project, Purchase Service Quota
project.note42: Customers can choose the IP Type based on the purchased package, and the quantity of IP is 1 when selected.
project.note43: Learn more about Floating IPs and Public IPs
project.note44: The File Storage service ensures data security, facilitates information sharing, and enhances file management capabilities.
project.note46: VPN Site-to-Site provides a secure connection channel between different physical locations or computer networks, allowing different geographical locations to access internal resources.
project.note47: For applications that require data protection and system performance maintenance, it is recommended to use Backup - precise backup to ensure safety and quick restoration when needed.
project.note48: Load Balancer helps distribute the load efficiently, improve system scalability, and enhance user experience.

app.backup.vm.tooltip.backup.package: Choose a backup package from the list of backup packages within the backup package feature of the platform service.
app.backup.vm.tooltip.security.group: The list of security groups assigned to the selected virtual machine. Customers are allowed to remove some security groups before initiating the backup process.
app.backup.vm.tooltip.volume.attach: The list of external attached volumes of the virtual machine, including volume type and volume capacity. Customers are allowed to remove some external volumes before backup.
